metadata.synopsis: While approaching the gith creche, climbing on a mountain, The player talks to a bird sitting in its nest. It's been bullied by the eagles on the roof, and if scared away it has a nest full of baked goods.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Take the alternative path to the monastery (no cable car), and just past the loot across the wooden bridge sits a hungry bluejay. Click on CRE_Bird_c85a9bab-49d6-476b-a07b-15e920c3cc24

11.speaker: Blue Jay
11.text: Glorious! Feathers bloody everywhere, mate! Feels good to be home in my nest.

41.speaker: Blue Jay
41.text: I wish there was something I could give you in return. Oh! Tell you what...

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Who said it's your nest? I killed the eagles. It's mine.

76.speaker: Blue Jay
76.text: Why do you want it? You lot don't even lay eggs! Let me have it - I'll make it worth your while.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Fine. What do you have for me?

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Actually, my kind do birth eggs.

56.speaker: Blue Jay
56.text: Weird. Does your kind like mysterious buried treasure more than bullying birds?

46.speaker: Blue Jay
46.text: Bet these eagle corpses'll scare any more of the big-wing bastards away.

55.speaker: Blue Jay
55.text: Let me guess. Defeat. It's to be expected, eagles are invincible after all.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: They're not invincible, I just haven't gotten round to it yet.

63.speaker: Blue Jay
63.text: Typical arrogance. Remember, tall one, pride comes before the fall. A very long fall.

94.speaker: Blue Jay
94.text: I've got nothing left to take, so you might as well shove off!

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Did someone steal something from you?

29.speaker: Player
29.text: That's a lot of attitude from a little bird.

53.speaker: Blue Jay
53.text: Maybe I wouldn't be so little if I had a proper dinner and a nest.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Is that why you're grumpy then? You're hungry?

8.speaker: Blue Jay
8.text: I'm not just hungry! But, also, yes. I am hungry.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: Is there not enough food around here?

3.speaker: Blue Jay
3.text: Not since the bloody eagles turned up and turfed me out of my first nest.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: So am I, and you look like a perfect portion.

47.speaker: Blue Jay
47.text: Hah! The eagles couldn't finish me off, and they're much bigger than you.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: I'm not here to take. I'm looking for a githyanki crèche. Have you seen one?

93.speaker: Player
93.text: I'm not here to take - just exploring. Seen anything interesting?

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I'm not here to take. Have you seen any of my people nearby?

2.speaker: Blue Jay
2.text: Do I look like a bloody tour guide?

113.speaker: Blue Jay
113.text: All I know is the roof's the best nest-spot on the whole Chionthar. I got there first, too. Before the thieves showed up.

80.speaker: Blue Jay
80.text: Steal? Eagles are bigger, they just take... Nest, prey, everything. That's how it works here.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I can't help but notice you have a nest right there.

26.speaker: Blue Jay
26.text: Oh, sure, a nest. But it's not my nest. That's up on the roof, with the eagles. Eagles are pricks.
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player sees a shot of the roof in the distance. NodeContext: "my nest" said with a deep longing

87.speaker: Player
87.text: I've already killed the eagles, luckily for you.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I can fight the eagles and get your nest back.

34.speaker: Blue Jay
34.text: It's a good lookout spot for food...
34.context: NodeContext: Food emphasised like something heavenly

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Wait, so if that's not your nest, whose is it?

78.speaker: Blue Jay
78.text: Some poor little tit who wasn't paying attention.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: So the eagles are pricks for stealing a nest, but you're not?

28.speaker: Blue Jay
28.text: Exactly right. Not all humans can grasp bird ethics, you should be proud.

75.speaker: Blue Jay
75.text: It's not even like the eagles need my nest, the drunk lizards they eat aren't hard to catch.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: I don't have time for petty bird squabbles.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Do you want me to go and deal with the eagles for you?

37.speaker: Blue Jay
37.text: Hah! You? Kill an eagle? But if you think you can...
37.context: NodeContext: Incredulous, eagles are the scariest things ever for them

104.speaker: Blue Jay
104.text: ...then please, please kill the eagles. They're the worst.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: I'll see what I can do.

32.speaker: Blue Jay
32.text: Thank you. I'll keep an eye on the roof. Rude bastards, those eagles. Deserve a little comeuppance.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: No. I'm not running your errands for you.

64.speaker: Blue Jay
64.text: You're not the first to be scared of the eagles, there's no shame in admitting it.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: You're in luck, the eagles are dead.

59.speaker: Blue Jay
59.text: Eagles can be killed? Incredible! Thank you, kind, tall, ugly stranger. My nest awaits.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Is that it? No reward for my heroic deed?

70.speaker: Blue Jay
70.text: I'm sorry... I'm just a bird. I don't have things to give you. Although...

90.speaker: Blue Jay
90.text: When I escaped the eagles, I spotted something buried near that ferry dock. Might be worth a look.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: What will you do if more eagles return to the roof?

24.speaker: Blue Jay
24.text: I'll either be killed or ask another poor sap to fight them again.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: Try and figure out what these lizards might be.

100.speaker: Narrator
100.text: *While quite vague, 'drunk lizards' could well point to kobolds, who tend to operate in packs.*

60.speaker: Narrator
60.text: *Alcoholic lizards didn't show up much in your studies of the natural world.*

101.speaker: Player
101.text: I'm here to avenge the bird you kicked out. Time to shove off.

4.speaker: Blue Jay
4.text: Curses! I was going to ask you to do the same thing, of course that tit got there first!

61.speaker: Blue Jay
61.text: Hah, not likely! That bird is long gone, no way you talked to them.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Stealing is the art of taking. It's a beautiful thing.

20.speaker: Blue Jay
20.text: Well, it feels rubbish. I miss my roof-nest.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: That's exactly how it works, and it's my turn. Get out, or I'll turn you into stew.

89.speaker: Blue Jay
89.text: It's not bloody fair! I got there first! The eagles don't even need it!

54.speaker: Player
54.text: It's about to get less fair. You have to leave this nest now, or else.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Surely the eagles need a nest as much as you?

109.speaker: Blue Jay
109.text: Not on top of the monastery, they don't!

99.speaker: Blue Jay
99.text: Don't you have anything better to do than bother me?

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I finished off those eagles for you, the top of the monastery is all yours.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I suppose I could turn you into dinner.

88.speaker: Blue Jay
88.text: No! Not again! I'd only just finished making nest number two!
